Html:
When creating classes in Typescript, you kind of expect that these classes (types) can be detected by 'typeof'

eg: 
Class MyDate {  }
var d = new MyDate()
console.log ( typeof( d ) );
result = 'object'
expected result = 'MyDate'

I know this is a 'limitation' of Javascript - but shouldn't it be possible to inject this functionality ??

a possible solution for my problem can be read here:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/13343150/custom-value-returned-by-typeof

I guess i just need to use that way instead ?
